item.title: Because Internet
item.description: It’s not just that we make patterns; humans are basically incapable of doing things without patterns Young women are the language disrupters Twitter, where you’re encouraged to follow people you don’t already know, has more linguistic innovation (not to mention [[notes/memes and social movements|memes and social movements]]) than Facebook, where you primarily friend people you already know offline [[notes/the curse of latin-y grammar|The curse of Latin-y grammar]] Grammar and spelling are collective agreements, not eternal truths; collective agreements can change What teens are doing is sophisticated [[notes/linguistic play as a writing exercise]] Reshaping informal writing into something that could more deeply convey the full range of human emotions [[Incoherence is the invitation to create]] Our language about emotion is embodied; you believe their body, not their words Japanese (eastern) anime and emoticons emphasize the eyes; western emphasizes the mouth Illustrative emoji (the birthday cake; it means what it means) vs.
